comment._content: One of three Bain photo portraits of American poet and humorist Arthur Guiterman (November 20, 1871 - January 11, 1943), obviously intended to be cropped to the head and shoulders. www.flickr.com/search/?w=8623220@N02&q=guiterman This image is used to illustrate his Wikipedia entry. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Guiterman

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content:
Thanks, artolog!  Your explanation of why the backdrop cloth is so short highlights the very practical methods news photographers relied on. It looks like Mr. Guiterman was invited over to the Bain News Service office for a quick portrait session; with shelves of negatives in the background.  Another view of the "negative library" is here,
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163811426/]
